item.title: Kerb stone upside down and trip hazard, 5th August
item.description:
Last time the council repaired the knocked over bollard by the Duchess of Kent pub they reinstalled the kerb stone upside down and it is uneven and a trip hazard. Not sure how they managed to do this, its very clearly upside down as all the rest of them are perfectly smooth and flat. The bollard has recently been smashed into and removed, when you replace it can you turn the kerb stone the correct way up please. thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sussex Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste services not providing a decent service, 5th August
item.description:
Every week the sole two bins at either end of Hoppers road are overflowing. They are rarely emptied, unless prompted. Then when prompted they leave behind the fly tips - see cones. - that have been dumped for so long - despite the website claiming tips are regularly cleared. And leaving the lids off is just an absolute disregard for our borough. It needs external investigation now. . .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive potholes at bus stop causing vibrations during the night., 5th August
item.description:
This was reported last year but still not fixed. There are massive pot holes and poor road surface across the 51 bus stop. As the buses go over these at night or during the day it cause vibrations on the nearby houses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clothes dumped in front Recycling bin on Great Dover street, 4th August
item.description:
There are clothes dumped infront of the Scope Clothes recycling bin which has been there over seven days. The location is on Great Dover Street. This has been reported many times but the items still remained on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Dover Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
